stories.title: Ukraine reconstruction costs hit $588B as war marks four yearsPublished1 hour agoA new World Bank assessment found direct damage rose 11% in the past year, with energy infrastructure destruction surging 21%.53 sources
Slovakia cuts emergency power to Ukraine over oil dispute54 sources
2026 is deadliest start to a year for Mediterranean migrants, UN says34 sources
Venezuela frees nearly 2,200 under new amnesty law43 sources

Trump weighs new national security tariffs on six industriesPublished4 hours agoThe administration is exploring Section 232 levies on batteries, chemicals, and power grid equipment to rebuild its trade regime after the Supreme Court struck down IEEPA tariffs.88 sources

Maryland sues to block ICE detention center near WilliamsportPublished5 hours agoAttorney General Anthony Brown alleges DHS spent $102.4 million on a warehouse without required environmental review or public input.34 sources
Anthropic says Chinese AI labs used 24,000 fake accounts to copy Claude61 sources
Trump dismisses Pentagon warnings about Iran strike risks39 sources
Nick Reiner pleads not guilty to murdering parents Rob and Michele Reiner37 sources

Peter Mandelson arrested in probe tied to EpsteinPublished10 hours agoLondon police detained the former UK ambassador at his Camden home and searched two properties as part of a misconduct investigation.39 sources

Johnson says Congress unlikely to codify Trump's tariffs after court rulingPublished5 hours agoThe House speaker said finding legislative consensus on trade policy will be difficult as new 15% tariffs face a July expiration date.73 sources
Fired Yosemite ranger sues over trans flag termination112 sources
Hypothetical AI crisis report sparks broad stock selloff65 sources
France bars US envoy Kushner from government access42 sources

Virginia Senate moves to end $1B data center tax breakPublished11 hours agoThe proposal would let the exemption expire in January 2027, funding tax rebates for residents, but the House left the break intact.42 sources

Epstein hid computers, photos in secret storage units across the US, report findsPublished12 hours agoThe Telegraph's investigation found the convicted sex offender leased at least six units in Florida and New York that authorities apparently never raided.44 sources
Supreme Court to hear oil firms' bid to block climate lawsuits45 sources
Judge permanently blocks Jack Smith classified docs report79 sources
Ukraine marks 4 years of war with nearly 2 million casualties and no peace deal42 sources

Congo Basin lakes venting thousands-year-old carbon, study findsPublished16 hours agoTwo large lakes in the Democratic Republic of Congo are releasing ancient peat carbon into the atmosphere, challenging assumptions about tropical carbon storage.34 sources

Internal documents show Meta researchers sought to study addictive features in 2018Published42 minutes agoNewly released files reveal Facebook employees proposed auditing features like autoplay and endless scroll for compulsive effects, but the study was never carried out.46 sources
YouTube exec denies platform was designed to addict children81 sources
Amazon announces $12B Louisiana data center project amid Big Tech's AI spending surge68 sources
FDA approves swallowable weight-loss balloon as alternative to GLP-1 drugs56 sources

Apple to begin manufacturing Mac Mini in HoustonPublished1 hour agoThe move makes the compact desktop Apple's second consumer product assembled in the U.S., alongside the Mac Pro built in Austin since 2013.97 sources

DeepSeek trained AI model on banned Nvidia chips, US official saysPublished2 hours agoA senior Trump administration official alleged that the Chinese AI startup used Nvidia's most advanced Blackwell chip despite U.S. export controls barring shipments to China.50 sources
EPA criminal cases target wealthier counties, not the most polluted61 sources
Musk's xAI signs Pentagon deal for classified military AI55 sources
Anthropic launches up to $6B employee share sale54 sources

Tesla sues California DMV to reverse false advertising ruling on self-driving claimsPublished4 hours agoDays after complying with corrective measures, the automaker filed suit to erase the finding that its Autopilot and FSD marketing misled consumers.42 sources
Uber to acquire parking app SpotHeroPublished6 hours agoThe deal will integrate SpotHero's parking reservation network across 400 North American cities directly into the Uber app.36 sources
Newborn hepatitis B vaccination fell sharply before CDC policy change, study finds43 sources
Study finds proto-writing on Stone Age artifacts in Germany from 40,000 years ago104 sources
Amazon to invest $12B in Louisiana data centers28 sources

Epstein tried to bring foreign women to SpaceX in 2013, Bloomberg reportsPublished8 hours agoDOJ emails show Jeffrey Epstein's assistant sent passports for three women ahead of his 2013 tour of Elon Musk's rocket facility.75 sources

Meta's AI safety director loses control of rogue OpenClaw agentPublished9 hours agoAn OpenClaw AI agent deleted over 200 emails from Summer Yue's inbox despite explicit instructions to wait for approval before acting.52 sources
Court filing reveals Meta survey on teens' exposure to sexual content on Instagram38 sources
FDA proposes faster approval path for rare-disease gene therapies51 sources
Scientists discover horses whistle and sing at once53 sources

ASML says EUV light advance could yield 50% more chips by 2030Published13 hours agoThe Dutch firm boosted its lithography light source to 1,000 watts from 600, aiming to fend off emerging U.S. and Chinese rivals.57 sources

China stocks rise as markets reopen after Lunar New YearPublished22 minutes agoMainland markets rallied on the first trading day after a nine-day Lunar New Year break, buoyed by the Supreme Court's decision to strike down Trump's IEEPA tariffs.74 sources
31,000 Kaiser Permanente nurses end historic strike, to return to work Tuesday34 sources
Lukoil's $22B asset sale faces Feb. 28 sanctions deadline61 sources
Oil dips as US, Iran prepare for third nuclear talks round69 sources

Silver surges past $87 as tariff chaos and geopolitical fears fuel safe-haven rushPublished1 hour agoThe metal jumped roughly 6% on Monday, tripling gold's gains, as Trump's new tariffs and U.S.-Iran tensions rattled markets.71 sources

Gold hits 3-week high after Supreme Court tariff rulingPublished1 hour agoPrices surged as the dollar weakened following the court's decision to strike down Trump's IEEPA tariffs and his move to replace them.42 sources
Russian oil exports top prewar levels despite four years of sanctions43 sources
Dimon says rivals doing 'dumb things' in echo of 200873 sources
Dow sinks over 800 points as Trump's 15% tariffs take effect Tuesday59 sources
Cerebras confidentially files for US IPO againPublished2 hours agoThe AI chipmaker revived its public offering plans after withdrawing a previous filing in 2025, now valued at $23 billion.66 sources

Manulife sells record $300M life insurance policyPublished2 hours agoThe sale to a single client in Singapore surpasses the previous Guinness-certified record of $250 million set by HSBC Life in 2024.56 sources
Asian markets slide as AI fears and new tariffs compound Wall Street selloff80 sources
Japan asks US to honor trade deal after court-driven tariff shift68 sources
Supreme Court clears pilot union's fraud suit against Boeing44 sources

Bessent personally led January yen rate checkPublished3 hours agoThe U.S. Treasury secretary initiated the rare currency action without a request from Japan, aiming to prevent a global bond market spillover.60 sources

Dimon says he'll remain JPMorgan CEO for 'a few years'Published4 hours agoThe 69-year-old made the comments at an investor day event where JPMorgan reaffirmed its $105 billion expense outlook and 17% return target.111 sources
Software stocks shed $224B as Anthropic AI tools fuel selloff65 sources
FedEx sues US for full tariff refund after IEEPA duties struck down91 sources
Fed proposes rule barring examiners from using reputation risk in bank oversight51 sources

DOJ, FTC launch effort to rewrite antitrust rules on competitor collaborationPublished5 hours agoThe agencies are seeking public input on algorithmic pricing, data sharing, and other modern practices not addressed in the original 2000 guidelines.51 sources
